reader.plugins
Class ExcelReader

java.lang.Object
  reader.plugins.ExcelReader
All Implemented Interfaces:
TabularDataReader
public class ExcelReader
extends java.lang.Object
implements TabularDataReader

TabularDataReader for Excel-format spreadsheet files. Both Excel 97-2003 format (*.xls) and Excel XML (*.xlsx) format files are supported. The reader attempts to infer if cells containing numerical values actually contain dates by checking if the cell is date-formatted. It so, the numerical value is converted to a standard ISO8601 date/time string (yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ss.SSSZZ). This should work properly with both the Excel "1900 Date System" and the "1904 Date System". Also, the first row in each worksheet is assumed to contain the column headers for the data and determines how many columns are examined for all subsequent rows.

hasNextTable

public boolean hasNextTable()
Description copied from interface: TabularDataReader
Test if there is at least one table waiting to be processed in the data source. This should always return true immediately after a new data source is opened (i.e., before any data has been read).

Specified by:
hasNextTable in interface TabularDataReader
Returns:
True if the data source has at least one more table waiting to be processed; false otherwise.

moveToNextTable

public void moveToNextTable()
Description copied from interface: TabularDataReader
Set the active table to the next table in the data source. After opening a data source, this method must be called in order to read the first table from the data source, even if it contains only one table (e.g., CSV files).

Specified by:

testFile

public boolean testFile(java.lang.String filepath)
See if the specified file is an Excel file. As currently implemented, this method simply tests if the file extension is "xls" or "xlsx". A better approach would be to actually test for a specific "magic number." This method also tests if the file actually exists.

Specified by:
testFile in interface TabularDataReader
Parameters:
filepath - The file to test.
Returns:
True if the specified file exists and appears to be an Excel file, false otherwise.
